title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making 

(Capacity) Act 2015 (Fees) Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited assisted decision-making (capacity) act 2015 (fees) regulation 2023

title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: 2. Subject to Regulations 3 and 4, there shall be paid to the Director in
text_raw:
2. Subject to Regulations 3 and 4, there shall be paid to the Director in 
respect of a matter specified in column (2) of Schedule 1 at any reference 
number a fee of the amount specified in column (3) of that Schedule opposite 
that reference number.
text_norm: 2 subject regulation 3 4 shall paid director respect matter specified column (2) schedule 1 reference number fee amount specified column (3) schedule opposite reference number

title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: 3. The Director may waive, either in whole or in part, a fee (other than the
text_raw:
3. The Director may waive, either in whole or in part, a fee (other than the 
fee specified in column (3) of Schedule 1 opposite reference number 7) that 
would otherwise be payable to the Director under Regulation 2, and, if 
applicable, remit or refund the amount of a waived fee already paid, where – 

(a) 

(b) 

the equivalised disposable household income, calculated in 
accordance with Schedule 2, of the person liable to pay the fee 
falls below the income threshold referred to in that Schedule, or 

in a case where paragraph (a) does not apply, the Director 
nevertheless considers that the fee would place an unreasonable 
financial burden on the person liable to pay that fee.
text_norm: 3 director may waive either whole part fee (other fee specified column (3) schedule 1 opposite reference number 7) would otherwise payable director regulation 2 applicable remit refund amount waived fee already paid - (a) (b) equivalised disposable household income calculated accordance schedule 2 person liable pay fee fall income threshold referred schedule case paragraph (a) apply director nevertheless considers fee would place unreasonable financial burden person liable pay fee

title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: 4. The Director may waive, either in whole or in part, a fee specified in
text_raw:
4. The Director may waive, either in whole or in part, a fee specified in 
column (3) of Schedule 1 opposite reference number 8 or 10 that would 
otherwise be payable to the Director under Regulation 2, and, if applicable, 
remit or refund the amount of a waived fee already paid, where – 

(a) 

the donor of the enduring power of attorney concerned 
previously created an enduring power under the Act of 1996, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [202] 3 

(b) 

(c) 

the enduring power under the Act of 1996 was not registered 
under section 10 of the Act of 1996, 

the enduring power under the Act of 1996 was revoked before 
the making of the application for registration of the instrument 
creating the enduring power of attorney concerned under section 
68 of the Assisted Decision-Making (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 
64 of 2015), and 

(d) 

a solicitor for the donor has provided confirmation of the 
matters referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c) in writing to the 
Director. 

 
 
 
 4 [202]

title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: The income threshold referred to in Regulation 3(a) is the “at risk of
text_raw:
1. 
The income threshold referred to in Regulation 3(a) is the “at risk of 
poverty” threshold calculated by the Central Statistics Office and published in 
its “Survey on Income and Living Conditions” from time to time.
text_norm: 1 income threshold referred regulation 3(a) risk poverty threshold calculated central statistic office published survey income living condition time time

title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: In order to calculate the equivalised disposable household income of the
text_raw:
2. 
In order to calculate the equivalised disposable household income of the 
person liable to pay the fee, the total household income of that person is 
divided by the total household value.
text_norm: 2 order calculate equivalised disposable household income person liable pay fee total household income person divided total household value

title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: Total household income includes:
text_raw:
3. 

Total household income includes: 

(a) 

(b) 

the net income of the applicant; 

the net income of the applicant’s civil partner, spouse or 
cohabitant.
text_norm: 3 total household income includes (a) (b) net income applicant net income applicant civil partner spouse cohabitant

title: and (d) of section 31 (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45(4)
heading: Total household income does not include:
text_raw:
4. 

Total household income does not include: 

(a) 

the income of persons on whom the applicant is 
dependent.
text_norm: 4 total household income include (a) income person applicant dependent
